title: Album Page, "Octagonal Plan and Elevation of a Monument", late 19th century
medium: Graphite on very smooth, thin cream wove paper tipped into binding with fabric
inscribed: Recto, in graphite, left side, upper left: base moulding
dimensions: Sheet: 29.5 x 46 cm (11 5/8 x 18 1/8 in.), approximate
description: Horizontal sheet folded to create two vertical halves. At left is an octagonal plan of a space, with smaller detailed sketches of the molding profile of a base, and to the right a detail of the entablature of an unknown structure, its molding types delineated clearly.  The right sheet contains a quickly drawn selevation of a monument with scrolling pediment and urn finial supported by two uniformly plain columns, all set upon a faceted base.

tombstone.epitaph:
Album Page, "Octagonal Plan and Elevation of a Monument", late 19th century.
late 19th century. Graphite on very smooth, thin cream wove paper tipped into binding with fabric. Gift of Mrs. William Greenough. 1943-51-320.
